snippet: A federal judge in Miami said a convicted spy could stay in Cuba, where he went for his father’s funeral, if he renounced his American citizenship.
abstract: Federal Judge Joan Lenard rules that convicted Cuban spy Rene Gonzalez can stay in Cuba, where he was allowed to go for his father's funeral, if he renounces his American citizenship.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Miami said a convicted spy could stay in Cuba, where he went for his father’s funeral, if he renounced his American citizenship.

headline.seo: Judge Allows René González, One of ‘Cuban Five’ Spies, to Stay in Cuba
headline.main: Judge Says Cuban Who Spied on U.S. Can Stay in Cuba
headline.print_headline: Judge Says Cuban Who Spied on U.S. Can Stay in Cuba
